intro: Thesium rugulosum, commonly known as the rough thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. Its yellowish-green flowers bloom in spring, and the plant is known for its resilience in arid conditions. Thesium rugulosum is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
